I got the following NPE when testing on GTK using 3.2 RC2 shortly after startup.

Yes, it's reproducable. It happens once after startup when a text hover is attempted in a Java editor. After the first time, hover works (it must use anothe r mechanism). It would appear that I do not have a compatible browser. I am using RH Enterprise 3.
Is the an NPE in the code we use to detect the browser or is this something else?
*** Bug 144961 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

from bug 144961:

Fails using Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxia32142-20050929
(SR3) (JIT enabled: jitc))

Problem does not occur with IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Linux
x86-32 j9vmxi3223ifx-20060124 (JIT enabled)

I am able to reproduce this with IBM's 20050929 VM, and it's clearly a VM bug.  For some reason the failure to load swt's mozilla library depending on libstdc++.so.6 (which is a valid failure) sabotages the fallback attempt to load swt's mozilla library depending on libstdc++.so.5 (this is not a valid failure on RH EL 3).  This works for me when I change to an IBM 1.4.2 VM that was released a few months later.  Marking as WONTFIX since this is a VM problem.
*** Bug 167627 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
